description.plain: Demetria Devonne “Demi” Lovato (born August 20, 1992) is an American singer-songwriter, musician, and actress. She made her debut as a child actress in Barney & Friends. In 2008, she came to prominence as a starring cast member in the television film Camp Rock. She signed to Hollywood Records the same year, and released her debut studio album Don’t Forget in September 2008. It has been certified Gold by the Recording Industry Association of America (RIAA). In 2009, Lovato was commissioned her television series, Sonny with a Chance. Now in 2018, she had six studio albums, “Don’t Forget” in 2008, “Here we go again” in 2009, “Unbroken” in 2011, “Confident” in 2015 and “Tell Me You Love Me” in 2017.

description.plain:
“Sorry Not Sorry” is an anthem towards Demi’s haters. In it, Demi confidently shows herself off to her haters, which makes them feel annoyed that she’s looking and feeling so good and they’re not. The track is lead single from her sixth album, Tell Me You Love Me.

The single was teased by Lovato and her team through cryptic updates on her social media accounts with the hashtag #SNS.

The song peaked at #6 on the Billboard Hot 100, which made it Demi Lovato’s highest career peak, besting her #9 peak of 2009’s “This Is Me.”

description.plain:
“Sober” is a single from Demi Lovato. A lyric video was uploaded to her official Youtube channel.

The song provides an open confession about facing recent challenges regarding her six-year sobriety. She made her achievement public on Twitter in March 2018:

https://mobile.twitter.com/ddlovato/status/974142838735884294?ref_src=twsrc%5Etfw&ref_url=http%3A%2F%2Fpopcrush.com%2Fdemi-lovato-celebrates-6-years-sober%2F

However, the lyrics indicate how she may have possibly relapsed; her prior battle with addiction included the use of prescription drugs, cocaine, and alcohol.

Her 2017 documentary, Simply Complicated, depicts her mixed struggle with addiction, bipolar disorder, and childhood experiences which have shaped her life and influenced her journey through fame and fortune.

https://giphy.com/gifs/demilovato-l4Ep3I9jWu72K1wty

description.plain:
“Tell Me You Love Me' is the title track of Demi Lovato’s sixth studio album Tell Me You Love Me. In the song, Demi Lovato shows her vulnerability and emphasizes the need for a relationship in her life. It then progresses to realizing that at the end of the day all you need, and what you will always have, is yourself.

The song was released as the first promotional single from Lovato'’s sixth studio album Tell Me You Love Me on August 23, 2017. It was then later released as the second single from the album on November 14, 2017.

description.plain:
“Stone Cold” is the third single of the album Confident, released on 9 October 2015. Unlike the previous two singles, it’s a tender ballad about wishing an ex the best in another relationship.

Demi Lovato played the song for the first time live during her performance at the Highline Ballroom in New York on 29 September 2015.

Demi Lovato told Complex in a 2015 interview that “Stone Cold” is her favorite song off of the album. “I want the Grammy committee to hear [that song],” she said, “so that one day they can see that—I know that I’m capable of getting there.”

description.plain:
Atop a wave of melancholy, Lovato sings of a seemingly unrequited love causing her to feel isolated in heart break. As she bemoans her precarious situation, the “How to Love” rapper, Lil Wayne lends his lyrical prowess to the track. Its production is handled by DJ Mustard, featuring sparse, ambient synths in contrasts with a trap-inflected minimalist beat.

Lil Wayne is the only collaboration on the standard version of Demi’s sixth studio album.

description.plain:
‘Smoke & Mirrors’ is the 16th song on Demi Lovato’s Target version of her 6th studio album ‘Tell Me You Love Me’.

Lovato revealed recently in a VEVO live interview, that ‘Smoke & Mirrors’ was the only song she cried to when recording.

This song lyrically expresses that Lovato was blinded by the emotional abuse that her lover gave to her. Now that she sees the person for who they really are, it was all just a perfect illusion. Now she is questioning if she had made the right decision.

description.plain: “Cry Baby” is about how Demi is strong willed and does not let her emotions control her when it comes to relationships. Although she is desperate for love, she refuses to let her significant others break her down. However, this particular relationship seems to have taken a different toll on her, contradicting her tough act.

description.plain:
“You Don’t Do It For Me Anymore” is the third single, but second promotional single for her sixth studio album Tell Me You Love Me.

Although the ballad can be interpreted as a breakup song, Demi said that to her the lyrics cover a topic she has been very vocal about it after recovery: drugs and alcohol. As explained in an interview with Next Radio, Lovato is breaking up with her old self, her addiction doesn’t do it for her anymore.

description.plain:
Released on July 1st 2015, “Cool For The Summer” is Demi Lovato’s most controversial song yet.

The lyrics have the former Disney child star discussing a very sexual summer affair, along with a suggestive music video in which articles of clothing can be seen strewn around a crazy party scene.

“Cool for the Summer” is the lead single from Lovato’s fifth studio album, scheduled for release in fall 2015 through a partnership between previous label Hollywood Records, Island Records, and its new subsidiary Safehouse Records, co-founded by Lovato.

description.plain:
“Daddy Issues,” is the fifth track from Tell Me You Love Me where Demi unveils the source of her attraction to “unavailable” men.

The term “Daddy Issues” refers the result of a messed up relationship with one’s father, or having an absent father in ones life. This results in younger women or men chasing older men and are even seeking a father figure from their relationships and mistreatment in some cases.

We are aware that Demi did not have a good connection with her biological father, Patrick Lovato, who died in 2013. Lovato has expressed her disconnection to her father from her previous songs, such as ‘For The Love of A Daughter (2011, Unbroken), ’Shouldn’t Come Back‘ (2013, Demi), ’Father‘ (2015, Confident).

description.plain:
“Give Your Heart a Break” is the last single from Demi Lovato’s third album Unbroken.

The song was written & produced by Josh Alexander and Billy Steinberg.

According to MTV, Demi explained that despite the play on the word “heartbreak” in the title, the song is the exact opposite, saying:

Last year, I began working on a song about a different love. It’s a song about showing someone you love that you’re the one right in front of them. This is a song about faith.“

The song peaked at #16 on the Billboard Hot 100, topped Billboard’s Mainstream Top 40 chart, #16 on Billboard’s Adult Contemporary chart, #12 on Billboard’s Adult Top 40 chart and #38 on Billboard’s Latin Pop Songs chart.

It was certified 3x Platinum by the RIAA with sales of 2,100,000.

description.plain:
“Ruin The Friendship” is about stepping out of a platonic relationship and crossing the boundaries with said person. Prior to the album release, Demi revealed to MTV that there was a song she was nervous to release because it would make headlines.

In an interview for Noisey, she stated that the song isn’t related to Wilmer Valderrama, who she used to be in a long-term relationship with. Fans believe she’s singing about one of her oldest friends, Nick Jonas, based on the lyrics.

description.plain: The 10th song of Lovato’s 2017 album, TMYLM (Tell Me You Love Me), Games is a song about Lovato’s relationship with a playboy who seemingly plays hard-to-get. In this song, Lovato stresses how, though she does harbor romantic feelings for him, she could play the same game he does, and that if he stops doing so, they could be a real couple. Cry Baby, the 9th song of her album, is theorized to be the aftermath of this, where she depicts herself being the heart-breaker who is heart-broken, indicating that he did not take her message seriously, and continued playing games.

description.plain:
Showing off a more adult sound, “Body Say” is the first single from Lovato’s new label, Island Records. The song was premiered at the first show of her Future Now Tour, which she co-headlines with Nick Jonas on June 29th. It was released soon after, with Demi tweeting:

https://twitter.com/ddlovato/status/748728093947236353

On instagram, Lovato also published numerous extra shots from the photoshoot for the album cover in promotion of the single’s release.

description.plain:
Title-track “Confident” is the second single of Demi Lovato’s fifth studio album. It allegedly leaked online on 21 August 2015 and it officially came out on 18 September 2015.

Lovato revealed the single cover on 15 September 2015.

https://twitter.com/ddlovato/status/643854137147437056?ref_src=twsrc%5Etfw

A preview of the music video was revealed on social media on 3 October 2015. It was premiered through Vevo on 9 October 2015. It’s directed by Robert Rodriguez and features actress Michelle Rodriguez.

https://instagram.com/p/8Yf8tuOKgv/

Lovato shared on 4 October 2015 a video on YouTube where she tells about the story behind the song:

“You’ve had me underrated”, I wanted to shout that from the top of my lungs for years now. Now that I’m feeling great and I feel confident, I’m proud of the skin that I’m in. I’m wanting to share that with the world and showing everyone how you can go from feeling very insecure with body image issues to feeling proud of your body that you want to show it to the world.

description.plain: In this song Demi Lovato expresses that she wants to move on without letting her past (or maybe even her abusive father) disturb her any further. Even though she knows that she’ll never be able to forget about her past because she not only has metaphorical but also real scars, this song shows a very determined side because Demi is sure that nothing and no one can hurt her as much as it used to.

description.plain:
This song was the first single from Demi Lovato’s album Unbroken, released in 2011.

It is about the pain she felt when she was in rehab because of her issues with self-harm and eating disorders.
This song was an inspiration for a lot of people; especially girls and women who were in pain because of other people who would tear them down without any good reason.

description.plain:
“Only Forever” is about wanting the person you want to explore a new relationship with to make that first move or take that next step. The track flows like a melancholic ballad with Lovato’s vocals echoing over minimal bassline.

The song almost acts like a sequel to “Ruin The Friendship”.

Since Demi said that “Ruin The Friendship” isn’t about Wilmer, a lot of fans think “Only Forever” is also about Nick Jonas, especially ‘cause of the “Future Now Tour” reference on the first two lines. They also sang a duet of Nick’s song “Close” on the tour that is in the pre-chorus of this song.

The song was released as the third promotional single preceding the album release.

description.plain:
“Hitchhiker” is a slow, romantic song about being able to depend on someone and feeling safe with them. She can wait for her lover, hence being the “hitchhiker,” and is 100% sure they will always come for her. Lovato debuted a lyric video on her YouTube account upon the release of her documentary, Simply Complicated.

At her NYC pop-up, Demi said,

This song is both sexy and a little risky, It’s about experimenting with that special someone and going on an adventure with them.

description.plain:
Iggy Azalea revealed the track “Kingdom Come” via Twitter on 26 August 2015.

https://twitter.com/IGGYAZALEA/status/636697969388089344

About Azalea’s collaboration, Demi told Ryan Seacrest:

“I am so excited not only to be one of her bridesmaids – Iggy is one of my closest friends – and it would be an honor to have her on my album. So, I’m trying to figure out which song right now, actually, to put her on. But it will definitely happen.”

In an interview with Australian entertainment website The Fix Azalea shared some thoughts about Lovato:

I think Demi is somebody that’s come a really long way in her personal journey, body image and musically…it’s been really awesome watching somebody come into their own skin. I’m super proud to see where she’s gone with this album and I’m excited for other people to see what’s changed with her."

description.plain:
“Father” is a song from Demi Lovato’s fifth album, Confident.

It’s an homage to her late father, Patrick, whom she rarely contacted after her parents' divorce. He died of cancer at the age of 53. After his death, she revealed that her dad had suffered from mental illness and she started the Lovato Treatment Scholarship Program in his honor.

Billboard talked to Lovato about the song she can’t wait for her fans to hear

The last song that I recorded was called “Father” and I’m particularly excited for this song. I get very, very honest about the passing of my dad. What people in general aren’t going to expect is the way that I sing the song. I took it more to a soulful, gospel kind of sound, and it’s the song that I might be most proud of.

She previously wrote the song “For the Love of a Daughter” about her relationship with her biological father.

description.plain:
“Neon Lights” is a track off of Demi Lovato’s demi-self-titled album, Demi.

It’s one of the more electro-pop-influenced songs, and it’s a simple two-prong love song.

It ironically outperformed Made in the USA as the 3rd US single.

description.plain:
“Lionheart” is a song from Demi Lovato’s fifth album, Confident. The song talks about the flame and fearlessness that is inside us because of the love we possess for each other.

Demi Lovato has stated that the song reminds her of her dog, Buddy who died in 2015 and how “his light will continue to shine within her.”

Jennifer Lopez revealed the track via Twitter on 26 August 2015.

https://twitter.com/JLo/status/636667650949677056

description.plain:
‘Ready For Ya’ is the 17th and final track on Demi Lovato’s Target Exclusive version of her 6th studio album ‘Tell Me You Love Me’.

Lovato recently revealed on VEVO Live that this song almost did not make it on the record.

This song lyrically expresses the immature and dark  state Lovato was in when a love interest came into her life. She loves them, but she simply was not ready to partake in this romantic relationship as she was not emotionally and romantically ready, due to being insecure with herself.

That was all I could make in my immature state

You caught me comin' off the back of another mistake

description.plain: “La La Land” is a song recorded by American singer Demi Lovato. It was released as the album’s second single. “La La Land” is one of six songs on the album co-written by the Jonas Brothers. The lyrics speak of Lovato feeling “out of place” in Hollywood.

description.plain:
“For the Love of A Daughter” is the fourteenth track from Demi Lovato’s third album Unbroken.
It was written by Demi and William Beckett (the former lead singer of The Academy Is…) & produced by Toby Gad.

The song was originally supposed to be featured on Demi’s 2009 sophomore album “Here We Go Again”, but Demi & her management felt that the subject of the song would be too much for her young audience.

During an interview with Women’s Wear Daily, Demi explained the reason the song was left off her second album was because:

When I took a step back, I realized I wouldn’t like those subjects being talked about in somebody else’s home with a seven-year-old and their mom.“

“For the Love of A Daughter” was later rewritten, re-recorded and chosen for the “Unbroken” album.

The song is about Demi’s relationship with her biological father, Patrick, whom she rarely saw after her parents' divorce when she was only two years old. According to this song and her unreleased song “Open” (which she wrote when she was 13), her father mentally and physically abused Demi, her mother and her sister.

On June 23, 2013, Patrick died of cancer at the age of 53 and after his death, Demi revealed that he had suffered from mental illness. In her father’s honor, she started the Lovato Treatment Scholarship program.

songs.lyrics:
[Verse 1]
Four years old, with my back to the door
All I could hear was the family war
Your selfish hands always expecting more
Am I your child, or just a charity ward?

[Pre-Chorus]
You have a hollowed out heart, but it's heavy in your chest
I try so hard to fight it, but it's hopeless
Hopeless, you're hopeless

[Chorus]
Oh, father
Please, father
I'd love to leave you alone, but I can't let you go
Oh, father
Please, father
Put the bottle down for the love of a daughter
Oh

[Verse 2]
It's been five years since we've spoken last
And you can't take back what we never had
Oh, I can be manipulated only so many times
Before even "I love you" starts to sound like a lie

[Pre-Chorus]
You have a hollowed out heart, but it's heavy in your chest
I try so hard to fight it, but it's hopeless
Hopeless, you're hopeless

[Chorus]
Oh, father
Please, father
I'd love to leave you alone, but I can't let you go
Oh, father
Please, father
Put the bottle down for the love of a daughter

[Bridge]
Don't you remember, I'm your baby girl?
How could you push me out of your world?
Lied to your flesh and your blood
Put your hands on the ones that you swore you loved
Don't you remember, I'm your baby girl?
How could you throw me right out of your world?
So young when the pain had begun
Now forever afraid of being loved

[Breakdown]
Oh, father
Please, father
I'd love to leave you alone, but I can't let you go
Oh, father
Please, father

[Outro]
Oh, father
Please, father
Put the bottle down for the love of a daughter
For the love of a daughter

description.plain:
“Waitin For You” is a song from Demi Lovato’s upcoming fifth album Confident, which was released on 16 October 2015. It’s a collaboration with rapper and singer Sirah.

Radio DJ Ryan Seacrest revealed the track via Twitter on 26 August 2015.

https://twitter.com/RyanSeacrest/status/636690517779070977

A snippet of the song was released on social media on 3 October 2015

https://instagram.com/p/8Y1xwXuKkD/

The music video premiered on 22 October 2015.

Radio DJ Ryan Seacrest revealed the track via Twitter on 26 August 2015.

https://twitter.com/RyanSeacrest/status/636690517779070977

A snippet of the song was released on social media on 3 October 2015

https://instagram.com/p/8Y1xwXuKkD/

The music video premiered on 22 October 2015.

description.plain:
“Old Ways,” is the third song on Confident’s track list and references the emotional and physical issues that Demi addressed in rehab in 2010.

“The first thing I think about is going back to a time when I was engaging in self-destructive behaviors, but it’s also like, now being at an age where I’ll go out to a club and I’ll look around the room, and there’s a bunch of people drinking, partying… it looks glamorous,” Lovato tells Billboard. “In that moment, I may think, ‘You know, it’s been a long time. Maybe I don’t have a problem anymore.’ Or ‘They look like they’re having so much fun.’ I easily remember how dangerous that spiral is, when you’re the type of person that lets it take over your life.”

“When you look forward and you write a new chapter in your book, that’s when the story really begins,” she adds.

A snippet of the song was placed on social media on 1 October 2015.

https://instagram.com/p/8RVROLuKgF/

description.plain:
“Don’t Forget” is the title track and last single from Demi Lovato’s 2008 debut album. The song was written by Demi and the Jonas Brothers, and produced by John Fields.

While most assume the song’s inspiration comes from a failed relationship of Demi’s, but her mother believes it was written for her father, and not one of her boyfriends.

According to Demi, it’s one of the songs on the album that she relates to and she felt “a lot of emotion while recording it.”

In an interview with PopEater, she said:

Everyone goes through the experience of falling in love, but then the other person just walks away and goes somewhere else. I went through an experience like that and wanted to write about it. I got over it and now a year later, I don’t have those feelings about that person anymore."

The song peaked at #41 on the Billboard Hot 100 and #62 on Billboard’s Pop Songs chart in 2009.

description.plain:
“Mr. Hughes” is a song from the deluxe version of Demi Lovato’s fifth album, Confident, released on 16 October 2015.

The song is about the first love she had when she was thirteen and not famous at the time. In an interview with iHeartRadio in 2012, Lovato told that she was “head over heels” with Scott Hughes, who was a varsity football player at her high school.

Kim Kardashian West revealed the track via Twitter on 26 August 2015.

https://twitter.com/KimKardashian/status/636617075952226304

description.plain:
This song, purported to be about her late, estranged father and described by Lovato as “emotional,” is about the pain that comes with difficult relationships.

Demi wrote this song before her father passed away. She had already written two songs about her father before this one: the unreleased song “Open”, which she wrote when she was 13, and “For The Love Of A Daughter”, in which she begged her father to stop drinking so he could have a loving relationship with his daughter. In “Shouldn’t Come Back”, Demi seems to have given up on their relationship.

description.plain:
One of the best songs on the album and the only one for which she receives sole writing credit. Lovato told The New York Times:

“Catch Me” was written by myself in my room. Those songs mean more to me than when we’ve got two weeks to finish an album and I’m with three different writers.

description.plain:
“Stars” is a song from the deluxe edition of Demi Lovato’s fifth album, Confident, released on 16 October 2015.

Pete Wentz revealed the track via Twitter on 26 August 2015.

https://twitter.com/petewentz/status/636701985492758528

It has also gained some recent attention for its similarities and alleged use of uncleared samples from “Infinity Guitars” by Sleigh Bells.

https://twitter.com/sleighbells/status/661239652087685120

description.plain: “Gift of a Friend” serves as the first bonus track from Demi Lovato’s sophomore studio album, Here We Go Again. The song was also featured on the soundtrack of the Disney movie Tinker Bell and the Lost Treasure, and was released as a single from said soundtrack. The song praises friendship and acknowledges the strength of these relationships in achieving success and journeying through life.

songs.lyrics:
At first I was afraid
I was petrified

Without you by my side

Thinking how you did me wrong

And so you're back
From outer space
I just walked into find you here
With that sad look upon your face

I should have made you leave your key

Go on now go walk out the door

Cause you're not welcome anymore

Did you think I'd crumble
Did you think I'd lay down and die
Oh no, not I
I will survive
Oh as long as I know how to love
I know I'll stay alive
I've got all my life to live
I've got all my love to give
And I'll survive
I will survive (hey-hey)

It took all the strength I had
Not to fall apart

Just feeling sorry for myself
I used to cry
But now I hold my head up high
And you see me
Somebody new

Still in love with you
And so you felt like dropping in
And just expect me to be free
And now I'm saving all my loving
For someone who's loving me

Go on now go walk out the door
Just turn around now
Cause you're not welcome anymore
Weren't you the one who tried to break me with goodbye
Did you think I'd crumble

description.plain:
“Heart By Heart” is a love song recorded for the 2013 film The Mortal Instruments: City of Bones. The track features bombastic orchestral and rock production styles, describing an epic love that reflects that of the main characters Clary and Jace.

Upon its release, the song received many positive reviews from critics. Hollywood Life named it “the best love song of the summer,” while Huffington Post described it as “hauntingly beautiful.”

Although it didn’t have an official promotion, the song went to #115 on the UK Singles Chart.

description.plain: “Two Worlds Collide” serves as the eighth track from Demi Lovato’s debut studio album, Don’t Forget. “Two Worlds Collide” is a song about a young couple who find strength through each other. The song was featured on the Disney Channel original movie Princess Protection Program, featuring Demi Lovato and Selena Gomez.

description.plain: “My Love Is Like a Star” serves as the thirteenth track from Demi Lovato’s third studio album, Unbroken. The song revolves around a relationship that is troubled by distance, but reassures the significant other that they’re always with them in mind, heart, and spirit no matter the distance, using comparisons to celestial bodies and the heavens.

The song revolves around a relationship that is troubled by distance, but reassures the significant other that they’re always with them in mind, heart, and spirit no matter the distance, using comparisons to celestial bodies and the heavens.

songs.lyrics:
[Verse 1]
The space in between us starts to feel like we're worlds apart
Like I'm going crazy, and you say it's raining in your heart
You're telling me nobody's there to dry up the flood
Oh, but that's just crazy
'Cause baby, I told you I'm here for good

[Chorus]
My love's like a star, yeah
You can't always see me, but you know that I'm always there
When you see one shining
Take it as mine, and remember I'm always near
If you see a comet, baby, I'm on it
Making my way back home
Just follow the glow, yeah
It won't be long, just know that you're not alone

[Verse 2]
I try to build the walls to keep you safe when I'm not around
But as soon as I'm away from you, you say they come tumbling down
But it's not about the time that we don't get to spend together
Oh, it's about how strong our love is
When I'm gone and it feels like forever

[Chorus]

You can't always see me, but you know that I'm always there

It won't be long, just know that you're not alone

[Bridge]
You say the time away makes your heart grow numb
But I can't stay just to prove you wrong
Oh, look at how far we've come
Don't you know, don't you know that you're the one?
Oh, you're not alone
You're not alone, oh
You're not alone, oh
You're not alone, oh
Know that you're not alone
You're not

[Chorus]
My love's like a star, yeah
You can't always see me, but you know that I'm always there
(Know that I'm always there)
When you see one shining
Take it as mine, and remember I'm always near, yeah
If you see a comet, baby, I'm on it
Making my way back home
Making my way back to you
Just follow the glow, yeah
It won't be long, just know that you're not alone
Yeah-yeah, yeah, oh, oh

description.plain:
“Remember December” is the last single from Demi Lovato’s sophomore album “Here We Go Again.”

According to Demi in an interview with MTV News, she said that the song is meant for “all her girls out there who need to remind guys that they messed up” and also said that the song’s different from her usual pop rock sound, stating:

“I love this song for many reasons. It had a different sound than a lot of my songs. I related to it personally more than other songs and I have so much fun with it. I thought if it could be a single that it would be incredible to perform it all the time.. What stands out about the song [is that] I can dance to it and rock out to it, which is ultimately my goal. I was just so excited when I heard this one ‘cause it’s the epitome of where I want to go with the future.”

The song peaked at #80 on the UK Singles chart in 2010.

description.plain:
“Unbroken” is the title song from Demi Lovato’s third album.

The song was written by Demi, Daniel James and Leah Haywood.

The song peaked at #98 on the Billboard Hot 100 and #60 on Billboard’s Digital Songs chart due to digital downloads.

description.plain: “Every Time You Lie” serves as the seventh track from Demi Lovato’s sophomore studio album, Here We Go Again. The song features a jazzy 70s vibe and was noted as a standout track from The Washington Post for being evidence as a promising future career for Lovato as an artist.

description.plain: “Trainwreck” serves as the third track from Demi Lovato’s debut studio album, Don’t Forget. It was the only song on the album completely written by Lovato herself. The song revolves around an unstable man and how the two lovers have been able to stay strong through their rocky relationship despite this man’s reckless behavior.

description.plain:
“All Night Long” serves as the opening track to Demi Lovato’s third studio album, Unbroken. The song features vocals from producer Timbaland as well as rap vocals from hip-hop artist Missy Elliott. Demi said of the track:

All Night Long is pretty much a party song and I recorded it when I went to Miami and I got to do a collaboration with Timbaland. When Missy Elliot heard the song she asked if she could be in the track and I could not say no because she is a rap legend so I said yes and the track turned out to be awesome, a lot of people liked it so far and I hope you guys continue to like it.

description.plain:
On “Mistake”, Demi sings about leaving someone who wasn’t good for her at all.

Demi said when she first heard the song, what caught her attention was the letter, stating:

I was fascinated by the fact that the girl has ended a relationship and it was the fault of someone else, his biggest mistake. I found it really interesting. a different view of a breakup. […] instead of sitting in the corner feeling heartbroken, you can hear this song and feel almost powerful, thinking ‘I will not let this keep me down. Was the biggest mistake him.’

Even though the song wasn’t released as a single, it managed to peak at #91 on the South Korea Gaon Chart.

description.plain:
Who’s That Boy is the second track from Demi Lovato’s third album Unbroken.

The song was written by Ryan Tedder, Noel Zancanella and Devin Tailes (also known as Dev, who is featured on the track).

It was supposed to be released as the second single from the album, but due to Dev’s pregnancy at the time, Demi decided to change the single to “Give Your Heart A Break”.

description.plain:
“Too Much Love” is an unreleased song from American singer Demi Lovato that leaked on Soundcloud on August 19th, 2016 after months of circulating amongst traders. The track was allegedly planned for Lovato’s 2013 album Demi but was ultimately scrapped.

The track details a relationship in which Lovato is so overcome by love after years of searching for something authentic that she’s prepared to give her all to her partner. She’ll never run out of admiration for her partner and all the ways that he complete hers. When she’s with him the hole in her life is filled.

description.plain: “On the Line” serves as the fifth track from Demi Lovato’s debut studio album, Don’t Forget. It features boy band, the Jonas Brothers, who also cowrote six songs featured on the album. “On the Line” is a song regarding a relationship that was so perfect that it was destined to crash and burn, and ultimately ended in breakup.

description.plain: “Stop the World serves as the ninth track from Demi Lovato’s sophomore studio album. The song was cowritten between herself and close friend Nick Jonas of the Jonas Brothers. The song revolves around a relationship that is frowned upon, but the two lovers being devoted to each other regardless. Sort of a Romeo and Juliet vibe.

description.plain: “Got Dynamite” serves as the eighth track from Demi Lovato’s sophomore studio album, Here We Go Again. The song has been credited by several critics as one of the best from the album, used to predict a promising career for Lovato as an artist. The song features violent lyrics in which Demi urges a boy to break down her protective barrier into her emotions.

description.plain:
Shut Up And Love Me is a song wrote by Demi with John Mayer that didn’t make the Here We Go Again final cut.
The two wrote three songs together, “World of Chances”, “Love is the Answer” and “Shut Up and Love Me”.
‘World of Chances’, the first song she wrote with Mayer, was the only of these songs to make the album’s final cut.

John Mayer is one of her biggest musical influences. January 2009 she told MTV:

“I sing a lot of rock, but this time I want to do more John Mayer-ish type of songs. Hopefully I can write with people like him. I love their music — it would be amazing.”

April 2009 John tweeted about Demi and they started a conversation online:



Later Demi Lovato said in interviews about the experience of working with John:

“He has always been one of my biggest musical influences. So we contacted his management about writing together. [When he said yes] I was completely shocked. It was more of a pipe dream. I didn’t ever think it would be a reality, but it came true. He was taking a chance on working with a younger artist in the pop realm. He also gave me advice about the media. How sometimes they can hurt your feelings and get you down. But he gave me this cool point of view. He told me to be encouraged even when people hate you.”

John Mayer told People about some of the advice he gave to Demi:

“When you’re young and you’re a star, just keep writing, keep working, keep developing,” he says. “Demi has a huge career in front of her… depending on the decisions she makes in her life.” And though he recognizes that it’s, “difficult to be seen in the public and continue to be vulnerable as an artist,” he says that at, “16 or 17 you gotta keep learning, [even if] people are watching you.”

description.plain:
“Open” is an unreleased song, written by Demi when she was 13 years old. The song describes how she feels about her mentally and physically abusive father, who suffers from depression and an addiction to alcohol.

Demi wrote three more songs about him: “For The Love Of a Daughter” (Unbroken), “Shouldn’t Come Back” (DEMI) and “Father” (Confident).

Demi wrote three more songs about him: “For The Love Of a Daughter” (Unbroken), “Shouldn’t Come Back” (DEMI) and “Father” (Confident).

songs.lyrics:
[Verse 1]

It's driving me crazy
It's like we stopped breathing in this room
We're both last to be leaving

I wish you'd make your move

[Chorus]

I wanna disappear
I'm hearing myself thinking too clear
It's too quiet in here

Why can't we break this silence finally?

You follow me home, but I never invite you inside
I see what you're not showing

[Chorus]

I wanna disappear
I'm hearing myself thinking too clear
It's too quiet in here
Make it all go away
Why can't we break this silence finally?

Don't stop, don't stop telling me goodnight
Just promise you'll kiss me goodbye
What's taking so long?
Don't tell me you're not gonna try
The tensions building in my mind
I wanna scream and I know why

It's much too quiet in here
I wanna disappear
I'm hearing myself thinking too clear

[Chorus]
It's too quiet in here
Make it all go away
Why can't we break this silence finally?
Make it all go away
It's too quiet in here

description.plain:
Aftershock is a song by Demi Lovato which is on the Japanese deluxe edition of her third album, Unbroken. It features production from Dreamlab and was written by Amy Pearson, Leah Haywood and Daniel James.

Aftershock is a club banger relating the effects of love to that of an Aftershock.

description.plain:
“Give Me Love” is a song that was originally by British singer-songwriter Ed Sheeran. It was then covered by Demi Lovato during an iHeartRadio performance on April 14, 2014. She also performed the song in the UK during a Capital FM session on June 3, 2014. Just days later, she went on to sing it as a duet with Ed Sheeran at My Big Night Out on June 16, 2014.

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=Gm_0IQuMTyU

description.plain:
“Gone” is the ballad written by Diane Warren. Produced by Demi herself.

You’re gonna ball your eyes out. She sounds better than ever on this song, vocals are Whitney level. Starts out with near whisper acapella vocals and builds to “I will always love you” realness.

description.plain: “Rascacielo” is the Spanish version of Demi Lovato’s 2011 comeback single “Skyscraper.” The song was released on July 22 of 2011 as a digital download. It was then included as a bonus track on the international deluxe edition of her 3rd studio album “Unbroken”. Demi then performed a Spanglish version of the song at the 2011 ALMA awards.

songs.lyrics:
[Verse 1: Demi Lovato]
Went down in South America
Met a boy in Colombia
Couldn't understand a word he said
So he took my hand instead
It was late as we ignored the time
Now I can't get this stranger off my mind
I think about him when I wear this dress
I still smell him in my hair

[Pre-Chorus: Demi Lovato]
Was it the heat making you sweat?
Was it the beat of the drum on my heart in my chest?

[Chorus: Demi Lovato]
"Eres muy bonita", he said
"No puedo esperar a verte otra vez"
I can't wait till I see you again
"Besame mucho, princesa"
And then we dance
He said "besame mucho"
He kisses my hand and we dance

[Verse 2: Demi Lovato]
It was time for me to say goodbye
Couldn't stand to look him in the eye
Would've kissed him if I had the time
Could've have sworn it was on his mind
Was it his lips, the way he moves his waist
His hands on my hips
Or just the look of desire on his face

[Chorus: Demi Lovato]
"Eres muy bonita", he said
"No puedo esperar a verte otra vez"
I can't wait till I see you again
"Besame mucho, princesa"
And then we dance
He said "besame mucho"
He kisses my hand and we dance

[Bridge: Demi Lovato]
And then I close my eyes
For a moment in time
In the blink of an eye
I lost him in the crowd
He was young to be found
When I turned around
But I swear I can still hear him now

[Chorus: Demi Lovato]
"Eres muy bonita", he said
"No puedo esperar a verte otra vez"
I can't wait till I see you again
"Besame mucho, princesa"
And then we dance
He said "besame mucho"
He kisses my hand and we dance
We dance

[Outro: Demi Lovato]
"Eres muy bonita", he says

description.plain:
“Back Around” is featured as the international digital bonus track from Demi Lovato’s debut studio album, Don’t Forget.

Demi was the victim of bullying in her younger years which she has opened up about and revealed the trauma it had caused her. She recalls this trauma in many of her songs through either the negatives or positive effects it has had on her.
In this case, “Back Around” is more of a positive song regarding Demi’s experience. She’s not letting this bully’s torment get to her, because she knows that karma is going to catch up to her.

songs.lyrics:
[Verse 1]
I glanced upon the ground today
I noticed something, it followed me along the way
A figure of gray, impersonating every move I make
For now, we'll call it my shadow
And it said will you replace it
So you'll be with me everywhere I go

[Chorus]
Sentences of yours running throughout my head
Searching for a chance to catch my breath
A never-ending dream
You'll become a part of me
Day or night, dark or light
You'll be taking over that thing called my shadow
Oh oh oh

[Verse 2]
And what happens on the days when
The clouds appear and fade away my shade?
Oh, that's our cue, babe
We'll run away to a place where the sun always shines
Not even time could erase
You're my weakness, babe, but you give me strength
I need you
I need you like the blood in my veins

[Chorus]
Sentences of yours running throughout my head
Searching for a chance to catch my breath
A never-ending dream
You'll become a part of me
Day or night, dark or light
You'll be taking over that thing called my shadow
Oh oh oh

description.plain: Abracadabra is an unreleased/leaked song by American pop singer Demi Lovato featuring the rapper Timbaland. Abracadabra was recorded for one of Demi’s albums, (probably Unbroken) however, it did not make the album’s final cut. The full song never been leaked, but 25 seconds of it ended up on YouTube.

songs.lyrics:
[Demi Lovato talking about "Skyscraper"]
"Skyscraper" is a really powerful song, and when I first recorded it, I was just doubled over in tears, and I was putting my everything into the song, because I wanted the song to turn out amazing, but I also knew it was an opportunity to let out so many emotions that I was feeling at that time, and this was before I had gone into treatment and gone into, gone through a lot of things in my life, and when I got out of treatment, I re-recorded the song and it just wasn't the same. I realized it was, because before I went in, recording "Skyscraper" was kinda like my cry for help, and I think that's what really is sort of magnetic about this song when you first hear it. Because it's so raw and so vulnerable, and I'm really really proud of it. And I've heard a lot of people tell me that "Skyscraper" changed their lives. So I'm really proud of it and I'm still overwhelmed about the magnitude of the access that it had. It's just been amazing! It's held a very special place in my heart.

songs.lyrics:
[Demi Lovato talking about "Give Your Heart a Break"]
''Give Your Heart a Break'' is an awesome song on the album. It's very upbeat, and it's about telling someone that you want to be that break for that person. You want to be that person that is protective and that is not gonna break the other person's heart, and that you want the other person to fall in love with you, and that you gonna take care of them. So I think it got a really beautiful message, and I think it's a fun song to dance to, and I think a lot of people will like it, and I hope that people really like the message too.

description.plain:
On December 24, 2012, singer and actress Demi Lovato released a cover of “Angels Among Us”, by Alabama to support the victims of the Newtown shootings.

In the beginning of the video she wrote:

“We can never imagine what the families in Newtown, CT are experiencing right now. And while there is nothing you can do to replace their loss, we can stand together and support them during this difficult time. This song is in honor to those angels we lost on December 14.”

In the beginning of the video she wrote:

songs.lyrics:
[Verse 1]
I was walking home from school on a cold winter day
Took a shortcut through the woods, and I lost my way
It was getting late, and I was scared and alone
When a precious baby boy took my hand and led me home
Mama couldn't see him, but he was standing there
And I knew in my heart, he was the answer to my prayers

[Chorus]
Oh, I believe there are angels among us
Sent down to us from somewhere up above
They come to you and me in our darkest hours
To show us how to live
To teach us how to give
To guide us with the light of love

[Verse 2]
When life held troubled times and had me down on my knees
There's always been someone there to come along and comfort me
A kind word from a stranger to lend a helping hand
A phone call from a friend just to say I understand

And isn't it kind of funny that at the dark end of the road
Someone lights the way with just a single ray of hope?

[Chorus]

[Bridge]
They wear so many faces
Show up in the strangest places
To grace us with their mercy in our time of need

[Chorus]

description.plain:
For the Love of A Daughter is the fourteenth track from Demi Lovato’s third album Unbroken.
It was written by Demi and William Beckett (the former lead singer of The Academy Is…) & produced by Toby Gad.

The song was originally supposed to be featured on Demi’s 2009 sophomore album “Here We Go Again”, but Demi & her management felt that the subject of the song would be too much for her young audience.

During an interview with Women’s Wear Daily, Demi explained the reason the song was left off her second album was because:

When I took a step back, I realized I wouldn’t like those subjects being talked about in somebody else’s home with a seven-year-old and their mom.“

“For the Love of A Daughter” was later rewritten, re-recorded and chosen for the “Unbroken” album.

The song is about Demi’s relationship with her biological father, Patrick Lovato, whom she rarely saw after her parents' divorce when she was only two years old. According to this song and her unreleased song “Open” (which she wrote when she was 13), her father mentally and physically abused Demi, her mother and her sister.

On June 23, 2013, Patrick died of cancer at the age of 53 and after his death, Demi revealed that he had suffered from mental illness. In her father’s honor, she started the Lovato Treatment Scholarship program.

http://vignette3.wikia.nocookie.net/demi-lovato/images/9/93/Patrick-lovato-con-le-figlie-demi-e-dallas.jpg/revision/latest/top-crop/width/320/height/320?cb=20130824044951

When I took a step back, I realized I wouldn’t like those subjects being talked about in somebody else’s home with a seven-year-old and their mom.“

songs.title: For the Love of a Daughter
songs.title_with_featured: For the Love of a Daughter

songs.lyrics:
[Demi Lovato talking about "For the Love of a Daughter"]
"For the Love of a Daughter" is a song about my childhood experiences and my past with my strange relationship with my birth father. And at the end of the day, no matter what I've been through with him, I'll still always love him. And basically I wrote the song to tell my side of the story, and everything that I have to say is in the song.

songs.lyrics:
[Demi Lovato talking about "Lightweight"]
So "Lightweight" is a really beautiful ballad that I sang when I was also in Miami recording with Timbaland, and it's such a beautiful song. It's about being very vulnerable to falling in love and opening up your heart and just being able to trust somebody with falling in love. So when I sang it, I put my heart into it, and I reflected in past experiences I could recall. You know, being afraid to fall in love, but just letting myself get to that point and, hmm... it was just a really emotional experience for me reflecting back on past relationships, but this song itself turned out really beautifully and I'm really proud of it.

annotatable.link_title: About Unbroken Introduction by Demi Lovato
annotatable.title: About Unbroken Introduction

songs.lyrics:
[Demi Lovato talking about her 3rd album, "Unbroken"]
Hey guys, it's me, Demi Lovato. I'm really excited for you all to hear "Unbroken". It's my new album, and it's really different than the other ones, like "Don't Forget" and "Here We Go Again", because it's taken on more of an R&B vibe rather than the pop-rock vibe, which I normally had on the last few albums. I have collaborations with Timbaland, Iyaz, Jason Derulo, Missy Elliot and Dev, so I'm really, really excited for you all to hear them. I think you guys are gonna love it, and I hope you continue to enjoy it!

annotatable.title: About "Together"

songs.full_title: Together by Demi Lovato (Ft. Jason Derulo)
songs.title: Together

songs.lyrics:
[Demi Lovato talking about "Together"]
So, this song "Together" is a song that I co-wrote, and when I first heard the song, I new it should be a duet, and we all agreed, and we decided that Jason Derulo should've come in and sing the song. So when he did, we were all so excited. He just happened to be in Miami. I think he was down there to his grandmother's birthday or something random for one night, and when we called him up and asked if he could do the song, he said, "Yes, you caught me right as I was, on like, one night in Miami visiting my grandma." So we were really fortunate. We were really lucky. Him in the studio, he was so professional, was really sweet an he's got an amazing voice. So I loved the song. It's like an anthem. It's kinda like "We Are the World" kinda song. It's... it's beautiful, and it's really about loving one another and bringing everyone together. I think it's got a really positive message.

songs.lyrics:
[Demi Lovato talking about "My Love Is Like a Star"]
"My Love Is Like a Star" it's actually written by Tody Gad and James Morrison, who I'm a huge fan of, and I loved his music for so long, and when I first heard the song it had James Morrison's voice on it. So... I'm sorry. When I first heard the song it had James Morrison's voice on it and I was like, "Oh my gosh, I have to sing this song, it's so amazing!" And I did, I sing it, and we changed some of the lyrics a little bit and it turned out to be an amazing song. It's probably one of my favorite songs on the album, just because it has such a different vibe to it. It's a lot more soulful and it's beautiful but also because James Morrison wrote on it and I'm [?].

songs.title: Unbroken

songs.lyrics:
[Demi Lovato talking about "Unbroken"]
"Unbroken" is a song that I wrote with a couple named Daniel James and Leah Haywood, and and they were with Dreamlab Productions, and we had a really great time working together. And one day, I decided, "You know, I really want a techno-house-dance kinda vibe for one of my songs." And they said, "Check out this beat that we have," and listened to it and I fell in love with it, and we instantly started writing to it. It seems to be one of my friends' favorite song, so whenever my friends wanna hear my record they always ask me to hear "Unbroken" first. So, I decided to name my album "Unbroken" because it also represents me and my journey and who I am today and after everything that I've been through, I'm still standing strong, "like a skyscraper," but also "unbroken" and it's also my favorite songs, so, yeah.

songs.lyrics:
[Demi Lovato talking about "In Real Life"]
"In Real Life" is a song about wanting someone that's gonna take care of you and that is gonna treat you like a lady, and a woman and it's, hmm, just got a really funny message to it. In the end of the song, you know, it turn around and she finds that, that person that takes care of her, and you know, gives her sweet kisses and, you know, roses and everything. I think it's a really cute song, but I love how musically the chord progression. It's just, it kinda takes you to on this roller coaster, I think it's really cool.

description.plain:
“Fall In Love” is a song by American singer-songwriter Demi Lovato, with singer-songwriter Christina Aguilera. The track was found registered on ASCAP Repertoire.



This is the duo second collaboration, previously on “Fall In Line”, from Christina’s ninth studio album Liberation.

songs.lyrics:
[Demi Lovato talking about "Mistake"]
When I first heard "Mistake", it was the lyrics who caught my attention. I was really intrigued by the fact that, you know, the girl had just been broken up with and it was the other person's fault, it was the other person's greatest mistake. So I thought that was really interesting as different take on a break up, rather than sitting around and feeling heartbroken. You can listen to it and feel kind of a [?]. Thinking like, "I'm not gonna let this get me down, it was his greatest mistake." So I loved the message of this song, and I hope you do too!

description.plain:
Demi’s cover of the smash record “Purple Rain” by Prince. This was performed at the Boston Pops Fireworks Spectacular 2016 in honour of Prince.
Prince’s definitive power ballad, Purple Rain peaked at No.2 on the Billboard 200 on November 17th the year it was released.

In 2015, Pitchfork named it the best song of the 1980s.

description.plain:
“For the Love of a Daughter (Demo)” is the demo version of Demi Lovato’s song song “For the Love of a Daughter”. The demo made it’s way online in 2012. The demo version features a different instrumentation than the album version of the song and slightly alternate lyrics.

The demo version of the song was intended for Lovato’s studio album Here We Go Again, but was not included on the album due to her label and management reportedly feeling the subject matter was too heavy for the album and Lovato’s audience at the time.

songs.lyrics:

Oh, father
Dear, father

Oh, father
Dear, father

Oh, father

[Verse 2]

And all I could hear, was the back and fourth

Oh, father

To a wife and a child that you swore you loved

description.plain:
“Really Don’t Care” is the fourth single from Lovato’s self-titled fourth studio album, Demi. The radio disney version of the song is featured on the Radio Disney Music Awards compilation.

The verse “Second guessing, but should’ve hit that” from Cher Lloyd’s bridge is taken out of the song due to it’s suggestive lyric.

body.plain:
“Really Don’t Care” is the fourth single from Lovato’s self-titled fourth studio album, Demi. The radio disney version of the song is featured on the Radio Disney Music Awards compilation.

The verse “Second guessing, but should’ve hit that” from Cher Lloyd’s bridge is taken out of the song due to it’s suggestive lyric.

songs.title: Really Don’t Care

songs.lyrics:
[Verse 1: Demi Lovato]
You wanna play, you wanna stay, you wanna have it all
You  started messing with my head until I hit a wall
Maybe  I should've known
Maybe I should've known
That you would walk, you would walk out the door (Hey)
Said  we were done, then met someone and rubbed it in my face
Cut  to the part, she broke your heart, and then she ran away
I guess you should've known
I  guess you should've known that I would talk, I would talk

[Chorus: Demi Lovato]
But even if the stars and moon collide
I never want you back into my life
You can take your words and all your lies
Oh-oh-oh,  I really don't care
Even if the stars and moon collide
I never want you back into my life
You can take your words and all your lies
Oh-oh-oh, I really don't care
Oh-oh-oh, I really don't care

[Verse 2: Demi Lovato]
I can't believe I ever stayed up writing songs about you
You don't deserve to know the way I used to think about you
Oh, no, not anymore
Oh, no, not anymore
You had your shot, had your shot, but you let go
Now if we meet out on the street, I won't be running scared
I'll walk right up to you and put one finger in the air
And make you understand
And make you understand
You had your chance, had your chance

[Chorus: Demi Lovato]
But even if the stars and moon collide
I never want you back into my life
You can take your words and all your lies
Oh-oh-oh, I really don't care
Even if the stars and moon collide
I never want you back into my life
You can take your words and all your lies
Oh-oh-oh, I really don't care
Oh-oh-oh, I really don't care

[Bridge: Cher Lloyd]
Yeah, listen up
Hey, hey, never look back
Dumbstruck boy
Ego intact
Look boy, why you so mad?
Hey, Demi, you picked the wrong lover
Should've picked that one, he's cuter than the other
I just wanna laugh, 'cause you tryna be a hipster
Kick it to the curb, take a Polaroid picture

[Chorus: Demi Lovato]
But even if the stars and moon collide
I never want you back into my life
You can take your words and all your lies
Oh-oh-oh, I really don't care
Even if the stars and moon collide
I never want you back into my life
You can take your words and all your lies
Oh-oh-oh, I really don't care
Oh-oh-oh, I really don't care

songs.lyrics:
It’s been a week since i’ve played league, i’m going through withdrawal
Already been 2 minutes in, told  me to uninstall
Oh yeah, I should’ve known, someone would cry and moan
So let them talk, let them talk all they want, hey!

Where to begin, looks like Lee Sin is chillin’ in the base
All these DC’s, the 1v3’s and random AFK’s
I think I should have known, my team is getting owned
We’re getting stomped, getting stomped

description.plain:
“Really Don’t Care” is the fourth single from Lovato’s self-titled fourth studio album, Demi. The difference between the album version and the solo version is that Cher Lloyd’s verse is taken out and replaced by a new one from Demi.

It is currently unknown the intention for why a solo version without Cher Lloyd was recorded.

“Really Don’t Care” is the fourth single from Lovato’s self-titled fourth studio album, Demi. The difference between the album version and the solo version is that Cher Lloyd’s verse is taken out and replaced by a new one from Demi.

It is currently unknown the intention for why a solo version without Cher Lloyd was recorded.

I wish it would snow tonight

'Cause I feel a separation coming on

You kiss me with those open eyes
It says so much, it's no surprise to you
But I've got something left to say

Don't surrender, surrender, surrender
Please remember, remember December
We were so in love back then, now you're listening
To what they say, don't go that way
Remember, remember December, please remember
Don't surrender

You said you wouldn't let them change your mind
'Cause when we're together fire melts the ice
Our hearts are both on overdrive
Come with me, let's run tonight
Don't let these memories get left behind

Don't surrender, surrender, surrender
Please remember, remember December
We were so in love back then, now you're listening
To what they say, don't go that way
Remember, remember December, please remember

I remember us together

We could do this, fight the pressure
Please remember December

Don't surrender, surrender, surrender
Please remember, remember December
We were so in love back then, now you're listening
To what they say, don't go that way
Remember, remember December, please remember
Don't surrender

[Intro]
I think I'd have a heart attack

[Verse 1]
Never put my love out on the line

I think I'd have a heart attack

I think I'd have a heart attack

[Chorus]
I think I'd have a heart attack
I think I'd have a heart attack
I think I'd have a heart attack
I think I'd have a heart attack
I think I'd have a heart attack

[Chorus]

'Cause I don't wanna fall in love

songs.full_title: Really Don't Care by Demi Lovato (Ft. Cher Lloyd)
songs.title: Really Don’t Care

songs.lyrics:
[Intro]
Oh-oh-oh, I...
I really don't care
Oh-oh-oh, I...

[Verse 1]
You wanna play, you wanna stay, you wanna have it all
You started messing with my head until I hit a wall
Maybe I should've known
Maybe I should've known
That you would walk, you would walk out the door (hey)
Said we were done, then met someone and rubbed it in my face
Cut to the part, she broke your heart, and then she ran away
I guess you should've known
I guess you should've known that I would talk, I would talk

[Chorus]
But even if the stars and moon collide
I never want you back into my life
You can take your words and all your lies
Oh-oh-oh, I really don't care
Even if the stars and moon collide
I never want you back into my life
You can take your words and all your lies
Oh-oh-oh, I really don't care

[Verse 2]
I can't believe I ever stayed up writing songs about you
You don't deserve to know the way I used to think about you
Oh, no, not anymore
Oh, no, not anymore
You had your shot, had your shot, but you let go
Now if we meet out on the street, I won't be running scared
I'll walk right up to you and put one finger in the air
And make you understand
And make you understand
You had your chance, had your chance

[Chorus]
But even if the stars and moon collide
I never want you back into my life
You can take your words and all your lies
Oh-oh-oh, I really don't care
Even if the stars and moon collide
I never want you back into my life
You can take your words and all your lies
Oh-oh-oh, I really don't care

[Drop]

[Chorus]
But even if the stars and moon collide
I never want you back into my life
You can take your words and all your lies
Oh-oh-oh, I really don't care
Even if the stars and moon collide
I never want you back into my life
You can take your words and all your lies
Oh-oh-oh, I really don't care

[Outro]
Oh-oh-oh, I...
I really don't care
Oh-oh-oh, I...

songs.title: Confident

songs.lyrics:
[Intro]
Are you ready?
Yeah, yeah, yeah...
Ha
Yeah

[Verse 1]
It's time for me to take it
I'm the boss right now
Not gonna fake it
Not when you go down
'Cause this is my game, and you better come to play
I used to hold my freak back, now I'm letting go
I make my own choice
Bitch, I run this show
So leave the lights on
No, you can't make me behave

[Pre-Chorus]
So, you say I'm complicated
That I must be out my mind
But you've had me underrated-rated-rated

[Chorus]
(Uh-huh) What's wrong with being, what's wrong with being
What's wrong with being confident?
(Uh-huh) What's wrong with being, what's wrong with being
What's wrong with being confident?

[Verse 2]
It's time to get the chains out
Is your tongue tied up?
'Cause this is my ground and I'm dangerous
And you can get off
But it's all 'bout me tonight (tonight, ha)

[Pre-Chorus]
So, you say I'm complicated
That I must be out my mind
But you've had me underrated-rated-rated

[Chorus]
(Uh-huh) What's wrong with being, what's wrong with being
What's wrong with being confident?
(Uh-huh, yeah) What's wrong with being (yeah), what's wrong with being (yeah)
What's wrong with being confident?
(Uh-huh) What's wrong with being, what's wrong with being
What's wrong with being confident?
What's wrong with being, what's wrong with being
What's wrong with being confident?

[Interlude]
Uh-huh
Hey!
La la, yeah
Yeah, yeah
Ooh yeah

songs.full_title: Heart Attack by Demi Lovato
songs.title: Heart Attack

songs.lyrics:
[Intro]
I think I’d have a heart attack
I think I’d have a heart attack

[Verse 1]
Never put my love out on the line
Never said "yes" to the right guy
Never had trouble getting what I want
But when it comes to you, I’m never good enough
When I don’t care, I can play ‘em like a Ken doll
Won’t wash my hair
Then make 'em bounce like a basketball

[Pre-Chorus 1]
But you make me wanna act like a girl
Paint my nails and wear high heels
Yes, you, make me so nervous that I just can’t hold your hand

[Chorus]
You make me glow
But I cover up, won’t let it show
So I'm putting my defenses up
'Cause I don’t wanna fall in love
If I ever did that, I think I’d have a heart attack
I think I’d have a heart attack
I think I’d have a heart attack
I think I’d have a heart attack
I think I’d have a heart attack
I think I’d have a heart attack
I think I’d have a heart attack
I think I’d have a heart attack
I think I’d have a heart attack

[Verse 2]
Never break a sweat for the other guys
When you come around, I get paralyzed
And every time I try to be myself
It comes out wrong like a cry for help
It’s just not fair
Pain’s more trouble than it all is worth
I gasp for air
It feels so good, but you know it hurts

[Pre-Chorus 2]
But you make me wanna act like a girl
Paint my nails and wear perfume for you
Make me so nervous that I just can’t hold your hand

[Chorus]
You make me glow
But I cover up, won’t let it show
So I'm putting my defenses up
'Cause I don’t wanna fall in love
If I ever did that, I think I’d have a heart attack
I think I’d have a heart attack

[Bridge]
The feelings are lost in my lungs
They’re burning, I’d rather be numb
And there’s no one else to blame
So instead, I’ll take off in a run
I’m flying too close to the sun and I’ll burst into flames

[Outro]
I think I’d have a heart attack
I think I’d have a heart attack
I think I’d have a heart attack
